intro: Hieracium chrysanthemoides, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with upright stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow to orange, arranged in flat-topped clusters, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium chrysanthemoides is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
